description: This file contains Python code defining configuration data structures, validation functions, and logic to load MongoDB settings from various sources such as JSON config files or environment variables. It includes a dataclass for representing MongoDB settings, validation functions for URI and other fields, and logic to resolve configuration file paths with a precedence order emphasizing explicit environment variables.

classes.name: MongoSettings
classes.description: Immutable data class representing the necessary MongoDB connection parameters: URI, database, and collection.

methods.name: None _validate_mongo_uri(uri: str)
methods.description: Validates that the MongoDB URI is a non-empty string and starts with an appropriate scheme.

methods.name: None _validate_non_empty(name: str, value: str)
methods.description: Checks that a string value for a given name is non-empty.

methods.name: dict _load_json_file(path: str)
methods.description: Loads JSON data from a file path, raising ValueError if JSON is invalid.

methods.name: MongoSettings _from_dict(cfg: dict, fallback_env: bool = True)
methods.description: Constructs a MongoSettings object from a configuration dictionary, optionally filling missing values from environment variables.

methods.name: Optional[str] _resolve_config_path()
methods.description: Determines which configuration file path to use based on environment variables and default locations.

methods.name: MongoSettings load_mongo_settings()
methods.description: Public function that loads and validates MongoDB connection settings from configuration files or environment variables, following precedence rules.
